title: Fixed and Periodic Points of the Intersection Body Operator
authors: Emanuel Milman, Shahar Shabelman and Amir Yehudayoff
abstract:
The intersection body $IK$ of a star-body $K$ in $\mathbb{R}^n$ was
introduced by E. Lutwak following the work of H. Busemann, and plays a central
role in the dual Brunn-Minkowski theory. We show that when $n \geq 3$, $I^2 K =
c K$ iff $K$ is a centered ellipsoid, and hence $I K = c K$ iff $K$ is a
centered Euclidean ball, answering long-standing questions by Lutwak, Gardner,
and Fish-Nazarov-Ryabogin-Zvavitch. To this end, we recast the iterated
intersection body equation as an Euler-Lagrange equation for a certain volume
functional under radial perturbations, derive new formulas for the volume of $I
K$, and introduce a continuous version of Steiner symmetrization for Lipschitz
star-bodies, which (surprisingly) yields a useful radial perturbation exactly
when $n\geq 3$.
